About the Role
As an Account Director, you’ll help drive the client partnership with one of our biggest Canadian clients. This position is a leadership role that sets the tone, pace, and ways of working. Our ideal candidate will weigh and balance client needs with company ambitions to determine the vision, and then make sure everyone is clear on that vision and how to get there. We’re looking for an energetic individual with an entrepreneurial spirit who’s comfortable taking on different tasks and solving problems—and can do it all while bringing a positive spark to people’s lives.
Our ideal candidate will weigh and balance client needs with company ambitions to determine the vision, and then make sure everyone is clear on that vision and how to get there. We’re looking for an energetic individual with an entrepreneurial spirit who’s comfortable taking on different tasks and solving problems—and can do it all while bringing a positive spark to people’s lives.
We are looking for a rockstar and well versed manager who has demonstrated: 
Responsibilities:

Responsibility for overall client satisfaction, quality of service, and on-time, on-budget completion of the agency’s digital production services
Overseeing all aspects of the program deliverables from briefing and development to final approval, working in close collaboration with internal producers and technical partners, as well as external creative partners.
As a leader on the team, you’ll work closely with various internal resources needed to ensure successful projects, and align the expectations of clients with the execution of digital versioning work. 
You’ll lead the day-to-day client relationship and agency partner relationships, and the first point of escalation when challenges arise.
Overall owner of scope, working closely with internal project management team to track account financials and scope delivery against 40+ annual client campaigns
Looking beyond the day-to-day needs of a large QSR account, ensuring the use of effective processes across the team and long-term stability. 
Participate in and/or lead account process optimization meetings, including new opportunities that may arise with the increasing capabilities that AI unlock.
Excellent time management and the ability to manage multiple complex projects simultaneously and prioritizing appropriately
Building and maintaining key relationships with agency partners and clients

About You
The essentials:

7+ years experience working on either the client side or agency side
Comfortable working autonomously and able to resolve or escalate issues appropriately
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong presentation skills
Identifying opportunities to enhance process & outputs in digital production, with use of marketing technology
Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems 
Strong understanding of digital marketing strategy and execution, including digital production
Demonstrated ability to execute large-scale marketing strategies and programs
A strong understanding of digital production, including practices and principles.
Experience as a strategic partner; who understands the client’s brand and business inside out, and will develop and oversee a roadmap for continued success
Demonstrated a successful ability to execute large-scale marketing strategies and programs
The experience to make thoughtful decisions--whether it’s related to people management, team development, client and agency relationship, or internal process--with foresight and follow through
Revenue growth acumen; is able to look after business planning and development to ensure targets and KPIs are met, identifies opportunities for new work that add overall value to the company
A clear communication style to team, creative agency and clients; is a natural diplomat with the ability to gather information and push back while maintaining positive relationships
A comfort level working autonomously and is able to resolve or escalate issues appropriately

At this time, all positions are exclusively work from home due to COVID-19. Occasional in-person presence at client offices in Toronto may be required.
At Media.Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission.  
Media.Monks is committed to ensuring equal access and participation for people with disabilities. We are committed to treating people with disabilities in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We believe in integration, and we are committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities in a timely manner. We will do so by removing and preventing barriers to accessibility and by meeting our accessibility requirements under local accessibility laws.What We Offer

Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.
